title: BA, Biology
text:
Institution
Kenyon College is a liberal arts institution known for its rigorous academics, strong writing programs, and emphasis on interdisciplinary learning.


Summary
Kenyon fostered my curiosity and honed my critical thinking, research, and communication skills—qualities that continue to guide me today. While my major was Biology, the education I received pushed me to grow and prepared me to excel in various academic and professional fields.

title: Undergraduate Researcher
text: For three years, I worked as an Undergraduate Researcher in the molecular toxicology lab of Dr. Wade Powell.

title: BA, Biology
text: I earned my Bachelor of Arts in Biology from Kenyon College in May 2020, gaining a strong foundation in scientific inquiry and problem solving.

title: BA, Biology
text:
Institution
Kenyon College is a liberal arts institution in Gambier, Ohio, known for rigorous academics, independent research, and emphasis on interdisciplinary learning.

title: BA, Biology
text:
Impact
Kenyon fostered my curiosity and honed my critical thinking, research, and communication skills—qualities that continue to guide me today. Studying Biology gave me a strong grounding in data-driven reasoning, whether it was designing experiments, analyzing results, or interpreting patterns. The interdisciplinary nature of my liberal arts education encouraged me to explore connections between seemingly unrelated fields, which now helps me bridge gaps between technical and business needs.
Kenyon’s emphasis on writing and communication also shaped my ability to present complex ideas in a way that is accessible and actionable. Whether I’m collaborating with stakeholders or building scalable solutions, the habits I developed at Kenyon are at the core of how I approach my work today.

title: BA, Biology
text: I earned my Bachelor of Arts in Biology from Kenyon College in May 2020, gaining a strong foundation in scientific inquiry and problem solving.

title: Analytics Engineer
text: At Montai, I work with an interdisciplinary team of analysts, engineers, and scientists to build the company’s core data platform. Although my official title is Data Scientist, my role entails responsibilities closer to an Analytics Engineer.

title: Analytics Engineer
text:
Institution
Montai Therapeutics is a machine-learning drug discovery start-up based in Cambridge, MA. The company’s mission is to leverage analytics and machine learning to predictably discover small-molecule therapeutics for chronic disease.

title: Analytics Engineer
text:
Responsibilites
My current role at Montai includes:

Gathering context and project requirements from key stakeholder
Developing data models to serve core data products

Creating web applications and reports to improve data-driven decisions
Writing clear documentation for both technical and general audiences
Leading design sessions to plan upcoming data archetecture
Collaborating across teams to ensure proper data quality and governances

title: Research Assistant - Bioinformatics
text:
Responsibilities
As a Research Assistant, my responsibilities in the lab included both wet-work and bioinformatics analysis. However, I quickly evolved into the lab’s primary bioinformatics specialist and spent the majority of my time generating, cleaning, and analyzing single-cell RNA sequencing data in models of vascular pathogenesis.

title: Undergraduate Researcher
text: For three years, I worked as an Undergraduate Researcher in the molecular toxicology lab of Dr. Wade Powell.

title: Undergraduate Researcher
text:
Institution
Kenyon College is a liberal arts institution known for rigorous academics, independent research, and emphasis on interdisciplinary learning.
My independent scientific research at Kenyon was performed in the molecular toxicology lab of Dr. Wade Powell, PhD. The lab studied environmental toxicants and their effect on the endocrine system.

title: Undergraduate Researcher
text:
Responsibilities
My responsibilities as a undergraduate researcher included:

Designing and conducting molecular biology experiments
Analyzing research data and synthesizing conclusions
Meticulously documenting my approach and findings in lab notebooks
Presenting results to lab meetings, poster sessions, and more
Training new members of the lab

Ultimately, my research in the lab would lead me to complete an Honor’s Thesis and receive High Honors for my public presentation and defense.

title: Research Assistant - Bioinformatics
text: For two years, I worked as a Research Assistant in the Vascular Biology lab of Dr. Timothy Hla at Boston Children’s Hospital.

title: Research Assistant - Bioinformatics
text:
Institution
Boston Children’s Hospital is a leading pediatric medical center known for its groundbreaking research and innovation. The hospital’s partnership with Harvard Medical School fosters a dynamic and collaborative scientific environment for discovery and clinical innovation.

title: Visualizing the MU Puzzle
text:
MU, MIU, MIUIU, MIUIUIUIU, …
If you’ve ever found yourself scratching these hieroglyphs into the margins of a paperback, you’ve likely encountered the MU Puzzle. It’s a puzzle, or maybe more of a lesson, from the book Gödel, Escher, Bach: an Eternal Golden Braid by Douglas Hofstadter. The book is a dense, esoteric tome on meta-mathematics, paradoxes, and how they relate to the nature of thought itself. It’s certainly not light reading, but I’ve always had an aspiration read it cover to cover.
However, a puzzle introduced early in the book has always captured by imagination.
